Text: Mnn... Zzzz...
Wanna hunt...and eat more...

Wherever she goes, Delta just hunts, eats, and
sleeps...
Should I bring her a blanket?
Yes. Thank you.

Now then, about you...who we've tenatively named
No. 122...

I feel much better now. Thank you for curing my
curse. I'm truly grateful.
Yes, I did cure your curse.

But ultimately, it was by the will of the lord of the
Shadow Garden, Master Shadow. You heard about
him from Lambda, didn't you?
Shadow Garden... Master Shadow...
...Does such a person really exist, Zinaida?

Watch your tongue! Both Lady Epsilon and I are your
superiors!

Once you chose and were accepted into the Shadow
Garden, you were no longer Instructor Olga! You are
No. 122!

...I accept the loss of my name. After all, a name is
meaningless to one who's become possessed.

However, I'm not the "fledgling" you like to refer to
either... You know that better than most, don't you?
You insolent...!
No. 122, watch how you speak towards your superiors.
Understood.

From our brief exchange, you clearly have some
attitude issues.

According to Lambda, you possessed no loyalty to
Velgalta and performed your job as an instructor
quite mechanically.
Zinaida's assessment is accurate.

I told you it's Lambda! And address your superiors
respectfully!

I didn't hate being an instructor per se, but I had
no attachment to Velgalta's army or its soldiers.

Meaning you also have no attachment to the Shadow
Garden?
Most likely.
How dare you, you ungrateful...!
Lambda.

...With all due respect, Lady Epsilon. I still oppose
allowing this individual to join the Garden.
Even though she is as competent as you?

I'm humbled by your assessment of me, but...her
cynical nature will surely disrupt the group's
discipline!
You're like her loyal lapdog, "Lady Lambda."
Keep your mouth shut!

...Well, as you pointed out, Lambda incorporating
No. 122 into the group without any precautions
could likely lead to issues.

So, she won't be returning to Alexandria. We'll use
her here locally.
Her?!

I'll explain the situation to Lady Alpha. You vouch
for No. 122's abilities, right, Lambda?

Well...in terms of practical abilities, once she gets
the hang of using slime, she'll be immediately
effective, but...!

There's ample work for No. 122, given her knowledge
of the local area, especially as we aim to expand
from our Laugus base to Velgalta.
You're "competent," aren't you? No. 122.

That move just now... Did you use magic energy in
that slash...?!

No matter the circumstances, you chose to survive and
fight for the Garden of your own volition.

So, regardless of the method for confronting the
Cult, make sure to produce tangible results.
I've brought a blanket—
Y-Yes!

I want you to work alongside No. 122 for the time
being.

Since she'll be stationed locally, make sure to brief
her on the Shadow Garden from the basics. Understood?
What? Me?

Well, well...I see. Looking forward to working with
you, Miss Former Baroness of the Seven Blades.
What's her deal? Why's she so rude?
Lady Epsilon...do you have some deeper intent?!

No. 111, No. 122. Make the most of each other's
abilities and temperaments.

I'm looking forward to seeing what kind of ensemble
you two make.
Ye...Yes!
...Understood.
Zzzz... Wild boar...meat... *drool*

...And so, given how things turned out, I'm feeling
slightly worried!
R-Right...

(The drill sergeant-esque character hired by Alpha
reunites with an old colleague she previously had
issues with.)

(...It's a scenario that feels vaguely familiar, yet
unlikely at the same time. Still, I've never come
across such a technical plot before.)

Maybe she used to be part of a theater troupe...?
Their improv skills are next level!
Master Shadow...?

Wait...but this former colleague of yours is
competent, right?

But if she strengthens the ranks of the Garden,
isn't that a good thing?

Yes. All the more reason why her blatant disregard
for the world, organizations, and others stands out.

(...Touche! This theater gal is even sticking it to
me!)

Plus, she insists on treating me as casually as she
used to, which hinders my role as an instructor.
Hmm...

(Why is she asking me for advice on handling an
overly familiar friend and junior? She seems like
she'd have more life experience than me...)

(Well, maybe this "responding to a subordinate's
concerns" scenario is part of Alpha's way of having
me embrace my shadowbroker role.)

...If you're worried about setting a bad example for
your other subordinates, you could just speak
informally with her in private.

I mean, even Alpha has that side to her. In her case
especially, she consciously switches between the two
personas.

You mean, Lady Alpha and even the other Seven Shadows
do that?!

On top of that, despite the front Alpha puts on, she
occasionally lets her guard down without realizing
it. You know, like...
"Cid. Today's stew is amazing."

...See what I mean? Sounds different from her usual
self, right?
R-Right...!

Lambda, you don't actually dislike this former
colleague of yours, do you?

W-Well...not exactly... We have a complicated
relationship.

In that case, why not have more personal
interactions?

There's no need for pretense among those who lurk
in the shadows.
Master Shadow...!

...Perhaps I've been putting up too much of a front
due to being overly focused on my duties and role.

(I-Is she seriously gonna bust out that line in that
getup and after all that buildup?)
Thank you for your wise words, Master Shadow!
Umm... Right...!

(She totally brushed off my imitation of Alpha! These
theater folk sure are a tough crowd!)
